title: Not your key not your BTC
author: Not your key not your BTC
content: I Used Cracked Windows 10 Activated (download from internet) on my laptop, and installed Electrum wallet.Is my wallet safe? is there a spy on the cracked windows? how do know that Cracked didn't inject malware and spyware, and send the data from my laptop to their server?

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: It's really not advisable to get pirated windows online; those who crack the windows are not running charity, and it's believed that they don't leave without infecting it with malware. One of the most common malwares for cracked windows is the Clipboard virus, which is among many that can be found on cracked devices, and some malware can't even be detected on your device.It's really not advisable to get pirated windows online; those who crack the windows are not running charity, and it's believed that they don't leave without infecting them with malware. One of the most common malwares for cracked Windows is the Clipboard virus, which is among many that can be found on cracked devices, and some malware can't even be detected on your device. You can start by checking if your PC is affected by the clipboard virus. Maybe try to copy and paste a wallet address, either bitcoin or any popular crypto address, and see if it will change to another address, as that's the most common way that the clipboard virus works. For the main time, if you don't have any funds in your wallet yet, I will advise you to get a new OS from a licenced dealer in order to be sure of what you are using and reduce the security risk that you are taking.

comments.body: If you can't afford a license and want to use a cracked version, why not use Linux they have different flavors, and at the same time they are safer than Windows, windows are prone to virus, here you can check this  https://www.stackscale.com/blog/popular-linux-distributions/I use Ubuntu, Centos, or Ubuntu for Lamp servers and firewalls, and for desktop use, I never encounter issues, what is also good is they have a great community try one of those that might fit your needs, hope this help.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Did you notice that you had to disable your Windows Defender to move the crack file? Some of these crack patches contain viruses and malware. We don't know if this spyware collects your data or not. It's not wise to use these cracks and financial software in the same OS. You can easily find cheap activation keys online. Windows has some resellers who sell those keys very cheaply. It's between $5 to $20 in Bangladesh. It is not worth taking such a risk for this amount. It's only if you are a Windows lover and you are friendly with this OS. Or you can move to Linux for better security.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Even if you were using a legitimate Windows with paid license, it still wouldn't be secure to use it as the OS for your bitcoin wallet. Windows by design is a spyware itself and from its inception it has always had a lot of backdoors some intentionally placed there by Microsoft!Use Windows only if you have to, and use it for your watch only wallet or at least a hot wallet with very small amount of bitcoin (pocket change) and create your main wallet on an air gap system as cold storage.

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: Never use cracked software. Never ever. If you are a normal user who doesn't do financial work in Windows or keep important documents, yeah, you can use crack. But it is still not advisable. But if you are a crypto user, obviously you are using bitcointalk, so you have knowledge of crypto. You shouldn't use crack. Who knows what kind of virus it contains?! And it's not that; Windows licenses are very expensive.And activating Windows won't give you superpowers. You can almost use every feature without activating it. I have been using it without a license for years. I never faced any issues.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Pretty difficult to know if a cracked and modified Windows 10 has malware or not as they're not open-source. But one thing's for sure — it ain't worth risking. If you don't have a hardware wallet(which you should get by the way), at the very least use a mobile wallet. It's likely to be more secure than your personal desktop/laptop computer.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: You will never know what is modified in the cracked version of your Windows and as said nobody is giving you the software for free, they always need something from you and that is why cracked and modded software are available for free.Apart from that private version will not receive security updates which puts you at further security risks if there is some kind of malware and it needs to be patched via the security update.So what you can do is make your cracked PC safer, my suggestion is gonna be different from what others suggested but it will work for you.You can install a Virtual machine software like Oracle and then install Linux in it which is open source and free of cost.And what you can achieve by doing this:It's like running another device inside your Windows machine so anything installed inside the VM will not be affected by the malware of Windows such as your Bitcoin wallet, which you can also use to store sensitive information and it will be completely prone to malware which attacks windows.It is more convenient for someone who is being a Windows user and can't afford two machines.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: I don't know much about other Windows activators but I do know that the KMS activator which is a very popular windows activator is not safe, that's why windows defender will sometimes sees the KMS activator as a big threat..It's full of many issues after installing on your PC, it can work for few days with no problem but later you will start getting some errors likeslui.exe ErrorCodeKMS error 0xc004f017KMS error 0xc004f038And the famous one is your virus detecting the r@1n error as a Trojan, I heard it's not safe because it's malware for for PC, some sources said it's hackers infecting PCs from users who aren't ready to buy a real Key and activate their OS, even if KMS activator is legit, hackers are now using it to get into peoples PC and their data..If you can't afford Windows KEY then find a free OS to download and use, Windows OS isn't the only one available, Linux OSs are free to use, you can do pretty much everything on Linux just like Windows OS, browse, install crypto wallets, etc and even Linux is more secured than Windows.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, you can use a hacked system for a long time. The Internet is full of assemblies that people have put together for different needs. But there may come a time when you have to lose everything. And you will tell us that you have been using this system for years, and something went wrong. If your system is under the surveillance of hackers, they can simply wait for the right moment and not waste their time on small things, but wait for a big catch. Another option is that many hacked systems are sold online as servers. Especially if your computer is powerful enough. Working from your IP, you may not know that, in parallel with you, someone is using your computer for their own needs and perhaps not doing exactly the right thing, and you will bear all responsibility after the incident since you provide access. Do you need such problems?

The ones who create cracks are experts at software engineering and reverse engineering and they can add malware, spyware, and any other virus in the crack easily. Most probably they add malware but in a way that's 100% undetectable by any available anti-virus program because the crackers know that the ones who use Windows OS are more likely to spend money online using credit cards and other stuff. I believe that you wallet isn't safe at all, I recommend you to wipe out your entire drives and then install Linux based Distro that's freely distributed and doesn't need any kind of crack in order to activate it. The Linux is the safest operating system out there and anyone who uses Linux is far more safe than the ones who rely on Windows OS. I know that most users like Windows OS because it's easily to use but these days there are many Linux distros that can be used be non-tech guys. The distros like Linux mint and Lubuntu are the ones that any user can use without much hassle. The best thing about Lubuntu is that it's less resource intensive and even runs of intel atom based laptops flawlessly.
